answers.answer: the rule of thumb is...when ever you are being treated for a yeast infection to make sure your partner uses the cream as well.   Chances are that he is re-infecting you or the infection was never completly gone to begin with.

i guess i just don't understand how he could be reinfecting me (we always use protection) if he doesn't have any symptoms.  also, i feel very silly for asking this, but what kind of creme (like, Vagisil, or Monistat?) would I give him to use, and where would he put it... ha, call me naive, but thanks for your help :D
I dont think your boyfriend is reinfecting you.  You may just have chronic yeast infections.  Have you been tested for diabetes?  That's one of the symptoms.
You didn't say in your original post that you and your boyfriend use protection i.e. condoms all the time.....if that is the case then he wouldn't be infected.

yeah, sparkeler, i had considered both of those.  i'm at school right now, so i'm having a hard time negotiating changing my bc with my doctor, but i'm going home soon.  i also plan to get checked for diabetes too, because my grandmother has it.  i appreciate your help :) it's put my mind a little more at ease.  i also just got that stuff RepHresh, so i'm going to see if that helps.
Also, the bc pills can be the culprit of your reoccuring yeast infections.

Are you 100% sure that you have a yeast infection?  Have you had a positive culture for yeast?  If not, and a doc can not find a biological cause there may be something else going on and it will have nothing to do with your bf.  If the problem continues I would suggest seeking out a vulvar specialists. Somtimes the nerves in our pelvis can become inflammed and cause yeast like symptoms.  Sex is a major trigger.

question: When my OBGYN first switched my bc, I flip flopped back and forth with some mild yeast infections, but they cleared up pretty easily with monistat or a prescription cream.  However,  I had one that started at the end of october that lasted for a month, finally clearing with Gynazole 1.  I waited a week after the Gynazole treatment was finished before having sex with my boyfriend again (and also did not have sex with him during the whole time I thought I was infected).  And now, here I am, about 2 weeks later, and I have another yeast infection.  I know you can recontract it through your partner, but if your partner doesn't seem to be having any problems, how can you tell if you're getting reinfected by him? I'm at my wits end with these things.  I think I just want an amputation :(
title: (yeast infection) How can I tell if I'm being reinfected by my boyfriend?
